definition: to jump/to hop/to skip over/to bounce/to palpitate

sentences.english: Please do not jump in the running elevator.
sentences.chinese: 在电梯运行过程中，请勿在电梯内蹦跳。

sentences.english: The child bounced on the bed.
sentences.chinese: 小女孩在床上蹦蹦跳跳。

sentences.english: There are many children gamboling around.
sentences.chinese: 那儿有很多嬉戏蹦跳的儿童。

sentences.english: I saw her hobble down the aisle.
sentences.chinese: 我看见她在过道边蹦跳着移动。

sentences.english: Four little kangaroos bounced on the bed .
sentences.chinese: 四只小袋鼠在床上蹦蹦跳跳。

sentences.english: Once under way, it was like riding along in a skip – until we reached full speed.
sentences.chinese: 车一开动就好像是在蹦跳着前进，直到加快到了全速。

sentences.english: Jump on the bed like you did as a kid.
sentences.chinese: 像孩子一样在床上蹦蹦跳跳。

sentences.english: Joey falls while jumping on the bed and dislocates his arm.
sentences.chinese: 乔伊在床上蹦蹦跳跳时把手摔到脱臼。

sentences.english: We see small children 25)bouncing up and down and 26)hollering with joy on the rope walkway.
sentences.chinese: 我们看见小孩们上下蹦跳，在绳索走道上欢乐地叫喊。

sentences.english: A deer skittered into the woods.
sentences.chinese: 一只鹿蹦跳着跑进了树林。

sentences.english: The children bounced into the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们蹦蹦跳跳地进了教室。

sentences.english: The boy squealed in delight bouncing up and down on the bed.
sentences.chinese: 这男孩高兴得尖叫，在床上蹦蹦跳跳。

sentences.english: The children and their dog were romping about on the grass.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们，还有狗在草地上蹦跳嬉戏。

sentences.english: Kids are gamboling around on the playground.
sentences.chinese: 小朋友在操场中蹦蹦跳跳的。

sentences.english: The little child danced around her at the sight of his mother.
sentences.chinese: 孩子一见到母亲就蹦蹦跳跳围着她转。

sentences.english: The ball bounces across the ground and rolls up to my feet.
sentences.chinese: 球在地上蹦蹦跳跳着，最后滚落到我的脚下。

definition: hands dance and feet trip (idiom); dancing and gesticulating for joy
to jump about/(of the heart) to beat wildly
to run like the wind/to rush/to gallop
to shake/to fling one's arm/to lash/to swing
to bounce/to jump/to hop/also variant of 蹦達|蹦达[beng4 da2]
to rotate/to twirl/to run around/to encircle/rotation/(coll.) to speak indirectly/to beat about the bush
to step on/to tread on/to wear (shoes)/(slang) to dump (sb)/Taiwan pr. [deng4]
to leap up/(coll.) to gush out/to spurt out
